DataElement.preferredName: Third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey Computated Value Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A computed value intended for use as a reference to interpret the results of pulmonary function tests/spirometry testing; the NHANES III value is a reference that is compared to the results of a subject's testing in order to derive percentage of expected values for pulmonary function testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Third National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey Computation Value
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A survey conducted between 1988 and 1994 on a nationwide probability sample of approximately 33,994 persons, age 2 months and over. The survey was designed to obtain nationally representative information on the health and nutritional status of the population of the United States through interviews and direct physical examinations._The act of calculating; determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
